581.sentence: kind of bulky and the wheel is awkward , but i can deal with that .

582.sentence: software definitely sucks , hangs up my notebook about half the time , but i do n't mind buying notmad .

583.sentence: i am annoyed that the player 's not automatically recognized as a hard drive .

584.sentence: i loved it until it broke , but less than a month is not an acceptible period of time for something to work .

585.sentence: i loved this product when i first got it - great sound , easy to use ( even though i agree that the software was n't the best ) and held enough songs to suit any mood .

586.sentence: i was willing to live with the larger size ( inconvenient on the road ) but the durability was a big zero .

587.sentence: always carried it in a case in by briefcase but one day the hard drive just zapped .

588.sentence: i am disappointed and looking elsewhere for something that can withstand the " rigor " of a business traveler .

589.sentence: the combination of the price , storage size , and player features makes this player the best on the market .

590.sentence: fact is , it could n't be easier to use .

591.sentence: sound quality on this is amazing , as with all creative products .

592.sentence: even leaving it on the default setting ( without the eax enhancements ) produces crystal clear playback .

593.sentence: the menu allows you to search for files by artist , genre , and album quite easily .

594.sentence: the battery stays charged for a long time , and takes no more than 2 or 3 hours at most to fully recharge via the included ac adapter .

595.sentence: connect the player to your computer ( via usb ) , open up mediasource , and you can listen to your stored mp3s as they stream directly from the xtra !

597.sentence: minor complaints : 1 ) even though the music is sorted via id3 tag on the player , the option to search for music contained in a folder is unavailable .

598.sentence: the zen xtra will transfer the files to the player , but not the folder name .

599.sentence: 2 ) having unfilled id3 tags will cause music to be potentially placed in a folder called " unknown . "

600.sentence: 3 ) with mediasource being so easy , i found no use for the bundled nomad explorer software .

601.sentence: in fact , it caused my system to hang more times than not , so i uninstalled it and stuck with mediasource 100 % .

603.sentence: first , the sound quality is okay , but ( as at least one other reviewer has mentioned ) the eax can cause audio interference after about 30 minutes .

604.sentence: second , the menu system and controls are poorly designed .

605.sentence: the toggle button that is used to scroll is poorly designed and does not work well .

606.sentence: the general button placement is not very user friendly .

607.sentence: third , the poor design continues with the case .

608.sentence: overall , a good buy for the price .

609.sentence: easy enough to navigate through , although i 'd prefer a sturdier button besides the thumbwheel scroll / pushbutton .

610.sentence: my biggest complaint is the battery life or lack there of .

611.sentence: there is no way the battery supplied lasts 14 hours !

612.sentence: i 've also had the nomad zen lock-up several times .

613.sentence: the nomad zen could use a little sturdier construction like the archos jukeboxes or some kind of shock resistant case .

614.sentence: at the very least , a sturdier more protective carrying case would be nice .

615.sentence: pros : huge storage capacity for the price , easy to navigate , can modify existing playlists on the fly , has a removable battery

616.sentence: battery life is about 1/4 of that advertised , no operators manual available for any of the nomad zen players ( on or off-line ) , occasional software lockups , replacement battery is expensive

617.sentence: creative zen feedback suffers from construction quality , poor product support , difficulty of using the scroll wheel and reasonably consistent feedback about problems with the headphone jack .

618.sentence: what is added in functionality ( battery replacement ) detracts in build quality as the face plate is prone to popping off .

619.sentence: feedback on creative 's product support is universally poor ; this is not limited to the zen , it applies to all the company 's products .

620.sentence: the scroll wheel is finicky ; it works most of the time but there is a learning curve for pressing it just right ; new users say they have 50 % - 75 % success rate ; some find it so frustrating that they just return the device .

621.sentence: the creative software is awkward / difficult to use and just plain does n't load on some computers .

622.sentence: enough people have reported that their headphone jack does n't work after a month of using the device to believe that creative has some inbuilt manufacturing or quality control problem .

623.sentence: the zen does n't support folders so it is not really a storage device ; even with third party software that " creates " folders , documents and programs can 't be launched from the zen , so it is not a hard disk , it 's a storage device at best .

624.sentence: reviews for sound quality are generally ( but not universally ) positive .

625.sentence: sure , this thing is definitely more cost-effective than an ipod .

626.sentence: but with a low price , comes lower quality .

627.sentence: our special friends at creative gave this thing good sound quality , great features , long battery life , and an unbeatable price .

628.sentence: the catch is it 's built like a piece of crap .

629.sentence: i did n't abuse it , i charged it every day , but the headphone jack just sort of fizzled out .

630.sentence: i bought the player this week and i like it by far .

631.sentence: removable and cheap battery - a li battery usually works properly for 1-3 years .

632.sentence: value : comparing data storage with price .

633.sentence: the appearance is okayed ( at least not ugly ) .

634.sentence: the size is small ( just a little bit bigger than an i-pod . )

635.sentence: easy to use : a lot of reviews has mentioned about this

636.sentence: the software , mediasource , cannot work on my pc . ( laptop , intel p4-2.0 , xp os ) .

637.sentence: in fact , each of my creative mp3 players had software problem in the first place .

638.sentence: in short , this player is good at size , value , hardware design but really bad at its software

639.sentence: the display is awesome , you can see everything you want and read it clearly

640.sentence: huge storage space , i loaded my entire collection of music , which isnt that much , 400 songs , and still have 26 gb , out of the 28 provided to you .

641.sentence: the sound is awesome , but if u put it too loud , depends on yoursound quality , the sound might crack .

642.sentence: with eax on , you can modify your sound , with 4 different presets , which is pretty good , you can get different variations with it .

643.sentence: if you use software correctly , put in all the id3 tags , you will get an awesome database collection , from which you can easily access your songs .

644.sentence: i dont know what other people are saying , but the software is awesome .

645.sentence: battery recharge , is an awesome thing , because it recharges in only like 2-3 hours .

646.sentence: when you turn on your player , the player turns on really fast , and the music continues to play , as you left it when you were turning it off .

647.sentence: you can manage your profile , change the contrast of backlight , make different type of display , either list or tabbed .

648.sentence: you can do other different things with it such as choose what kind of " now playing " interface , you can see the interface as modern or classical .
